contents.item: We are born entrepreneurs, true entrepreneurs of ourselves! Who defines the success or failure of our companies, it's us! Do not blame God for this, for even seeking it depends on you.
What most new entrepreneurs don’t realize is that before you can lead a business, or a family, or a ministry, or even just another person, you have to be the leader of yourself, first.
contents.owner: Kevin J.  Donaldson, Lead and Succeed 7 Wealth Principles of Today's New Leaders

contents.item: Thinking big is a skill all entrepreneurs should be focused on cultivating.
When I told my sister, who was a fashion designer in college, what I wanted to do, she said I was crazy. But once I got started, I couldn't turn back. Kimberly Goodwin, Snapping Turtle Kids
contents.owner: Holly Hurd, Venture Mom: From Idea to Income in Just 12 Weeks

contents.item: One thing that unites triumphant entrepreneurs, whether in Brooklyn, San Francisco or Great Falls, Montana, is strength of character.Individuality is the goal that we all strive to excel at in some way; the notion that we are distinct, special, that there is something teachable about our wisdom, something remarkable about our outlook.
contents.owner: Brian D'Ambrosio, From Haikus to Hatmaking: One Year in the Life of Western Montana

contents.item: This is what entrepreneurship is all about. You start off operating from a garage. And, end up, operating from a car.
Entrepreneurs often underestimate costs and overestimate rewards. But the fact that they estimate & still take action sets them apart from peers.
Don't be afraid to start small, entrepreneurship takes courage to win, and look for quick wins while setting a short and long term vision
